response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21 years old)", "medium", "Young adults tend to have a higher risk of recidivism, but at 21 the risk is not as elevated as with older habitual offenders."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "high", "Males statistically exhibit higher rates of recidivism compared to females."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest, 1 conviction)", "high", "A prior arrest and conviction are strong indicators of potential future reoffending."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Recent drug use increases risk, though marijuana is less strongly linked to violent behavior than other substances."],
    ["Mental Health (Depressive symptoms)", "medium", "Experiencing periods of significant depression can destabilize behavior and increase risk factors."],
    ["Living Situation (Living alone)", "medium", "Living alone may indicate lower social support, which can correlate with higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Educational Engagement (High school diploma and college enrollment)", "low", "Engagement in education generally serves as a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Employment History (1 job during the year)", "medium", "Limited job stability can contribute to economic and social risks associated with recidivism."],
    ["Family Background (Raised by biological mother in a household of 3 in a rural area)", "low", "A stable family environment in a smaller household and rural setting often reduces risk."],
    ["Religious Belief (Belief in God influencing personal events)", "low", "Spirituality or religious beliefs sometimes serve as a protective factor, supporting personal accountability."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 198 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
